title: Processes - Volume with Washer Method - Other Axes

content.question: Let <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the shaded region enclosed by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the cosine of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis for <math alttext="the negative of the fraction pi over 2, less than or equal to x, less than or equal to the fraction pi over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 2 to the fraction pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the cosine of x plus 1, close parenthesis, minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></msubsup><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 2 to the fraction pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the cosine of x, close parenthesis, squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 2 to the fraction pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the cosine of x minus 1, close parenthesis, squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 2 to the fraction pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the cosine of x plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from the negative of the fraction pi over 2 to the fraction pi over 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, the cosine of x plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, minus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>π</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
